thread.title: Watch: Videos you may have missed this week
thread.title_full: Watch: Videos you may have missed this week

author: Megan Camponovo
title: Watch: Videos you may have missed this week
text: From a cat being reunited with its family after being trapped in a sewer to a deputy climbing into a moving truck to save a driver suffering a medical emergency, here are some of the videos you may have missed this week:Cat reunited with family after eight weeks trapped in sewerA Minnesota cat has been reunited with his family after being trapped in a sewer for nearly eight weeks.The cat, named Drifter, went missing in mid-July. Neighborhood kids heard meowing from a storm drain at a nearby construction site, leading his family to investigate. In the video player above: see raw video of the rescueDeputy climbs into moving truck to save driver suffering medical emergencyA life-saving scene played out on a busy stretch road in Michigan with a heroic act by a sheriff's deputy.Deputies Nicole Miron and Anthony Gross, with the Macomb County Sheriff's Department, were notified that a silver GMC Sierra pickup truck was driving erratically.Gross was driving, and Miron rolled down her window and tried to get the driver to stop, but he appeared to be in a daze. The driver managed to briefly hit his brakes and that's when Miron climbed from her passenger seat into the moving truck. The deputy was able to stop the truck.A Vermont bakery takes the cake for the largest whoopie pieDream Maker Bakers in Killington, Vermont, made culinary history Saturday at the third annual Rutland Whoopie Pie Festival.The bakery set out to make the largest whoopie pie in the world. The weight was calculated at 1,187 pounds, beating the previous record by exactly 120 pounds.A bewildered seal found itself in the mouth of a humpback whaleIt's a good thing seals aren't on a humpback whale's menu.A photograph by a whale-watching naturalist captured a seemingly bewildered seal in the mouth of a humpback whale after the giant marine mammal accidentally gulped it last Thursday in the waters off Anacortes, Washington.
